count.name: Count
count.desc: The total number of items in a dataset. It gives an idea of the size of the dataset.

sum.name: Sum
sum.desc: The total sum of all numerical values in a dataset. Useful for understanding the total magnitude of the data.

product.name: Product
product.desc: The result of multiplying a set of numbers together. Shows the compounded effect of data points.

max.name: Max
max.desc: The largest number in a dataset. Indicates the upper limit of the data.

min.name: Min
min.desc: The smallest number in a dataset. Shows the lower limit of the data.

mean.name: Mean
mean.desc: The average of a dataset, found by dividing the sum of all numbers by the count of numbers. Helps indicate the central tendency.

median.name: Median
median.desc: The middle value in a dataset when it is ordered in ascending or descending order. A measure of central tendency that is not skewed by outliers.

mode.name: Mode
mode.desc: The value that appears most frequently in a dataset. Indicates the most common value.

range.name: Range
range.desc: The difference between the largest and smallest values in a dataset. Measures the spread of the data.

variance.name: Variance
variance.desc: The average of the squared differences from the mean. Measures how spread out the data is around the mean.

sample_variance.name: Sample Variance
sample_variance.desc: Similar to variance, but for a sample subset of a population. Provides a measure of the spread within the sample data.

standard_deviation.name: Standard Deviation
standard_deviation.desc: The square root of the variance. Measures the amount of variation or dispersion in a set of values.

sample_standard_deviation.name: Sample Standard Deviation
sample_standard_deviation.desc: The standard deviation calculated for a sample of a population. Indicates the variability within the sample.

median_absolute_deviation.name: Median Absolute Deviation
median_absolute_deviation.desc: The median of the absolute deviations from the dataset's median. A robust measure of variability.

interquartile_range.name: Interquartile Range
interquartile_range.desc: The difference between the 75th and 25th percentiles. Measures the spread of the middle 50% of data.

harmonic_mean.name: Harmonic Mean
harmonic_mean.desc: The reciprocal of the average of the reciprocals of the data set. Useful for rates and ratios.

geometric_mean.name: Geometric Mean
geometric_mean.desc: The nth root of the product of n numbers. Useful for sets of numbers whose values are meant to be multiplied together or are exponential in nature.

root_mean_square.name: Root Mean Square
root_mean_square.desc: The square root of the average of the squares of the numbers. Measures the magnitude of a set of numbers.

sample_skewness.name: Sample Skewness
sample_skewness.desc: A measure of the asymmetry of the probability distribution of a real-valued random variable about its mean. Indicates how much the sample leans towards one side.

sample_kurtosis.name: Sample Kurtosis
sample_kurtosis.desc: A measure of the 'tailedness' of the probability distribution of a real-valued random variable. Indicates how sharp or flat the distribution is compared to a normal distribution.

need_gte_zero: Must be greater than or equal to zero
